info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 07 at 6:13PM MDT until September 07 at 6:30PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM MDT FOR CENTRAL BROADWATER...MEAGHER...JUDITH BASIN...SOUTHEASTERN TETON...SOUTHWESTERN CHOUTEAU AND CASCADE COUNTIES... At 611 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles east of Dutton to 19 miles south of Belt to near Townsend, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts, and blowing dust. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Visibility will be reduced to less than 2 miles at times in blowing dust. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Townsend, Fort Benton, White Sulphur Springs, Stanford, Belt, Dutton, Highwood, Black Eagle, Geyser, Power, Carter, Neihart, Fort Logan On The Smith River, Floweree, Eden, Sapphire Village, Fort Logan, Stockett and First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. If you have to drive within the warned area, be prepared for significant reduction in visibility.
